content.description: 4 bolts to 2 shared open shuts. Â First climb, on the left, in the cave between Drifter and Little Cheops. Climb up and right following pockets.
content.location: In the cave between Drifter and Little Cheops, first route on the left, near entrance from Drifter.

content.description:
A fun route on the far right, more vertical than overhanging, side of the wall.  Starts on some thin holds (Back wall is off!) and continues that theme for over half the route until you find a

Thank God

hueco.  At that point ignore the deep huecos to the left and head right and up onto some thin almost non existant holds to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts to an open shuts anchor
content.location: Farthest right on the wall, just left of the cave.

content.description: Starts just right of an arete on vertical terrain up to an alcove under a roof.  A few big moves to get through that, a huge jug to rest on, and then sustained thin pockets on a slab to the top. Consistent and a decent length (for the area) but probably not the .12a that's listed in the guide. Regardless, one of the better climbs in the area, and in the park in my opinion.
content.protection:
7 bolts plus anchors.

The missing bolt was replaced some time ago, but there's a few spinners now.
content.location: Main line on the Drifter Wall, can't miss it.

content.description: climb the route to the right of The Shadow, 4 bolts to 2 shared open shuts.
content.location: To the right of the Shadow in the middle of the cave before scrambling up and over to little cheops.
